intro: Cyclostemon nitidus, commonly known as the glossy cyclostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
